channel.title: Ramblings
channel.description: Interesting things about machine learning and biology

item.title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Frogs?
item.description:
Google DreamDream

Google recently blogged about a visualisation tool called DeepDream they made for visualising neural networks. Neural networks are often described as black boxes - although they can approximate any function, the structure of the network doesn’t give insight to the structure of the function being approximated. The original aim of the tool was to help understand how neural networks carry out classification tasks, but Google found the process can generate “beautiful” (terrifying) art.

Hallucinations

The final product.

I supplied this sad frog to Google DeepDream via the ipython notebook (instructions here).

As the network tries to classify these sad frogs some patterns emerge.

Portions of different species of bird begin to appear along with a car and some legs.

In the last iterations the network classified dozens of eyes.
